00057 /* max value for numeric network address */
00058 #define MAX_NUMERIC_VALUE 0xffffffff
00059 
00060 #define IPSTRING_LENGTH 16
00061 
00062 /* CAVEAT VENDITOR! Keep the canonical string representation of nets/nids
00063  * consistent in all conversion functions.  Some code fragments are copied
00064  * around for the sake of clarity...
00065  */
00066 
00067 /* CAVEAT EMPTOR! Racey temporary buffer allocation!
00068  * Choose the number of nidstrings to support the MAXIMUM expected number of
00069  * concurrent users.  If there are more, the returned string will be volatile.
00070  * NB this number must allow for a process to be descheduled for a timeslice
00071  * between getting its string and using it.
00072  */
00073 
00074 static char      libcfs_nidstrings[LNET_NIDSTR_COUNT][LNET_NIDSTR_SIZE];
00075 static int       libcfs_nidstring_idx;
00076 
00077 char *
00078 libcfs_next_nidstring(void)
00079 {
00080         char          *str;
00081 
00082         str = libcfs_nidstrings[libcfs_nidstring_idx++];
00083         if (libcfs_nidstring_idx ==
00084             sizeof(libcfs_nidstrings)/sizeof(libcfs_nidstrings[0]))
00085                 libcfs_nidstring_idx = 0;
00086 
00087         return str;
00088 }
00089 
00090 static int
00091 libcfs_lo_str2addr(const char *str, int nob, __u32 *addr)
00092 {
00093         *addr = 0;
00094         return 1;
00095 }
00096 
00097 static void
00098 libcfs_ip_addr2str(__u32 addr, char *str, size_t size)
00099 {
00100         snprintf(str, size, "%u.%u.%u.%u",
00101                  (addr >> 24) & 0xff, (addr >> 16) & 0xff,
00102                  (addr >> 8) & 0xff, addr & 0xff);
00103 }
00104 
00105 /* CAVEAT EMPTOR XscanfX
00106  * I use "%n" at the end of a sscanf format to detect trailing junk.  However
00107  * sscanf may return immediately if it sees the terminating '0' in a string, so
00108  * I initialise the %n variable to the expected length.  If sscanf sets it;
00109  * fine, if it doesn't, then the scan ended at the end of the string, which is
00110  * fine too :) */
00111 static int
00112 libcfs_ip_str2addr(const char *str, int nob, __u32 *addr)
00113 {
00114         unsigned int    a;
00115         unsigned int    b;
00116         unsigned int    c;
00117         unsigned int    d;
00118         int             n = nob; /* XscanfX */
00119 
00120         /* numeric IP? */
00121         if (sscanf(str, "%u.%u.%u.%u%n", &a, &b, &c, &d, &n) >= 4 &&
00122             n == nob &&
00123             (a & ~0xff) == 0 && (b & ~0xff) == 0 &&
00124             (c & ~0xff) == 0 && (d & ~0xff) == 0) {
00125                 *addr = ((a<<24)|(b<<16)|(c<<8)|d);
00126                 return 1;
00127         }
00128 
00129 #ifdef HAVE_GETHOSTBYNAME
00130         /* known hostname? */
00131         if (('a' <= str[0] && str[0] <= 'z') ||
00132             ('A' <= str[0] && str[0] <= 'Z')) {
00133                 char *tmp;
00134 
00135                 tmp = calloc(1, nob + 1);
00136                 if (tmp != NULL) {
00137                         struct hostent *he;
00138 
00139                         memcpy(tmp, str, nob);
00140                         tmp[nob] = 0;
00141 
00142                         he = gethostbyname(tmp);
00143 
00144                         free(tmp);
00145 
00146                         if (he != NULL) {
00147                                 __u32 ip = *(__u32 *)he->h_addr;
00148 
00149                                 *addr = ntohl(ip);
00150                                 return 1;
00151                         }
00152                 }
00153         }
00154 #endif
00155         return 0;
00156 }
00157 
00158 int
00159 cfs_ip_addr_parse(char *str, int len, struct list_head *list)
00160 {
00161         struct cfs_expr_list *el;
00162         struct cfs_lstr src;
00163         int rc;
00164         int i;
00165 
00166         src.ls_str = str;
00167         src.ls_len = len;
00168         i = 0;
00169 
00170         while (src.ls_str != NULL) {
00171                 struct cfs_lstr res;
00172 
00173                 if (!cfs_gettok(&src, '.', &res)) {
00174                         rc = -EINVAL;
00175                         goto out;
00176                 }
00177 
00178                 rc = cfs_expr_list_parse(res.ls_str, res.ls_len, 0, 255, &el);
00179                 if (rc != 0)
00180                         goto out;
00181 
00182                 list_add_tail(&el->el_link, list);
00183                 i++;
00184         }
00185 
00186         if (i == 4)
00187                 return 0;
00188 
00189         rc = -EINVAL;
00190 out:
00191         cfs_expr_list_free_list(list);
00192 
00193         return rc;
00194 }
00195 
00196 static int
00197 libcfs_ip_addr_range_print(char *buffer, int count, struct list_head *list)
00198 {
00199         int i = 0, j = 0;
00200         struct cfs_expr_list *el;
00201 
00202         list_for_each_entry(el, list, el_link) {
00203                 assert(j++ < 4);
00204                 if (i != 0)
00205                         i += snprintf(buffer + i, count - i, ".");
00206                 i += cfs_expr_list_print(buffer + i, count - i, el);
00207         }
00208         return i;
00209 }
00210 
00217 int
00218 cfs_ip_addr_match(__u32 addr, struct list_head *list)
00219 {
00220         struct cfs_expr_list *el;
00221         int i = 0;
00222 
00223         list_for_each_entry_reverse(el, list, el_link) {
00224                 if (!cfs_expr_list_match(addr & 0xff, el))
00225                         return 0;
00226                 addr >>= 8;
00227                 i++;
00228         }
00229 
00230         return i == 4;
00231 }
00232 
00233 static void
00234 libcfs_decnum_addr2str(__u32 addr, char *str, size_t size)
00235 {
00236         snprintf(str, size, "%u", addr);
00237 }
00238 
00239 static void
00240 libcfs_hexnum_addr2str(__u32 addr, char *str, size_t size)
00241 {
00242         snprintf(str, size, "0x%x", addr);
00243 }
00244 
00245 static int
00246 libcfs_num_str2addr(const char *str, int nob, __u32 *addr)
00247 {
00248         int     n;
00249 
00250         n = nob;
00251         if (sscanf(str, "0x%x%n", addr, &n) >= 1 && n == nob)
00252                 return 1;
00253 
00254         n = nob;
00255         if (sscanf(str, "0X%x%n", addr, &n) >= 1 && n == nob)
00256                 return 1;
00257 
00258         n = nob;
00259         if (sscanf(str, "%u%n", addr, &n) >= 1 && n == nob)
00260                 return 1;
00261 
00262         return 0;
00263 }
00264 
00273 static int
00274 libcfs_num_parse(char *str, int len, struct list_head *list)
00275 {
00276         struct cfs_expr_list *el;
00277         int     rc;
00278 
00279         rc = cfs_expr_list_parse(str, len, 0, MAX_NUMERIC_VALUE, &el);
00280         if (rc == 0)
00281                 list_add_tail(&el->el_link, list);
00282 
00283         return rc;
00284 }
00285 
00286 static int
00287 libcfs_num_addr_range_print(char *buffer, int count, struct list_head *list)
00288 {
00289         struct cfs_expr_list *el;
00290         int i = 0, j = 0;
00291 
00292         list_for_each_entry(el, list, el_link) {
00293                 assert(j++ < 1);
00294                 i += cfs_expr_list_print(buffer + i, count - i, el);
00295         }
00296         return i;
00297 }
00298 
00299 /*
00300  * Nf_match_addr method for networks using numeric addresses
00301  *
00302  * \retval 1 on match
00303  * \retval 0 otherwise
00304  */
00305 static int
00306 libcfs_num_match(__u32 addr, struct list_head *numaddr)
00307 {
00308         struct cfs_expr_list *el;
00309 
00310         assert(!list_empty(numaddr));
00311         el = list_entry(numaddr->next, struct cfs_expr_list, el_link);
00312 
00313         return cfs_expr_list_match(addr, el);
00314 }

00318 static bool cfs_num_is_contiguous(struct list_head *nidlist);
00319 static void cfs_num_min_max(struct list_head *nidlist, __u32 *min, __u32 *max);

00463 
00464 static const size_t libcfs_nnetstrfns =
00465         sizeof(libcfs_netstrfns)/sizeof(libcfs_netstrfns[0]);
00466 
00467 static struct netstrfns *
00468 libcfs_lnd2netstrfns(__u32 lnd)
00469 {
00470         int     i;
00471 
00472         for (i = 0; i < libcfs_nnetstrfns; i++)
00473                 if (lnd == libcfs_netstrfns[i].nf_type)
00474                         return &libcfs_netstrfns[i];
00475 
00476         return NULL;
00477 }
00478 
00479 static struct netstrfns *
00480 libcfs_namenum2netstrfns(const char *name)
00481 {
00482         struct netstrfns *nf;
00483         int               i;
00484 
00485         for (i = 0; i < libcfs_nnetstrfns; i++) {
00486                 nf = &libcfs_netstrfns[i];
00487                 if (!strncmp(name, nf->nf_name, strlen(nf->nf_name)))
00488                         return nf;
00489         }
00490         return NULL;
00491 }
00492 
00493 static struct netstrfns *
00494 libcfs_name2netstrfns(const char *name)
00495 {
00496         int    i;
00497 
00498         for (i = 0; i < libcfs_nnetstrfns; i++)
00499                 if (!strcmp(libcfs_netstrfns[i].nf_name, name))
00500                         return &libcfs_netstrfns[i];
00501 
00502         return NULL;
00503 }
00504 
00505 int
00506 libcfs_isknown_lnd(__u32 lnd)
00507 {
00508         return libcfs_lnd2netstrfns(lnd) != NULL;
00509 }
00510 
00511 char *
00512 libcfs_lnd2modname(__u32 lnd)
00513 {
00514         struct netstrfns *nf = libcfs_lnd2netstrfns(lnd);
00515 
00516         return (nf == NULL) ? NULL : nf->nf_modname;
00517 }
00518 
00519 int
00520 libcfs_str2lnd(const char *str)
00521 {
00522         struct netstrfns *nf = libcfs_name2netstrfns(str);
00523 
00524         if (nf != NULL)
00525                 return nf->nf_type;
00526 
00527         return -1;
00528 }
00529 
00530 char *
00531 libcfs_lnd2str_r(__u32 lnd, char *buf, size_t buf_size)
00532 {
00533         struct netstrfns *nf;
00534 
00535         nf = libcfs_lnd2netstrfns(lnd);
00536         if (nf == NULL)
00537                 snprintf(buf, buf_size, "?%u?", lnd);
00538         else
00539                 snprintf(buf, buf_size, "%s", nf->nf_name);
00540 
00541         return buf;
00542 }
00543 
00544 char *
00545 libcfs_net2str_r(__u32 net, char *buf, size_t buf_size)
00546 {
00547         __u32             nnum = LNET_NETNUM(net);
00548         __u32             lnd  = LNET_NETTYP(net);
00549         struct netstrfns *nf;
00550 
00551         nf = libcfs_lnd2netstrfns(lnd);
00552         if (nf == NULL)
00553                 snprintf(buf, buf_size, "<%u:%u>", lnd, nnum);
00554         else if (nnum == 0)
00555                 snprintf(buf, buf_size, "%s", nf->nf_name);
00556         else
00557                 snprintf(buf, buf_size, "%s%u", nf->nf_name, nnum);
00558 
00559         return buf;
00560 }
00561 
00562 char *
00563 libcfs_nid2str_r(lnet_nid_t nid, char *buf, size_t buf_size)
00564 {
00565         __u32             addr = LNET_NIDADDR(nid);
00566         __u32             net  = LNET_NIDNET(nid);
00567         __u32             nnum = LNET_NETNUM(net);
00568         __u32             lnd  = LNET_NETTYP(net);
00569         struct netstrfns *nf;
00570 
00571         if (nid == LNET_NID_ANY) {
00572                 strncpy(buf, "<?>", buf_size);
00573                 buf[buf_size - 1] = '\0';
00574                 return buf;
00575         }
00576 
00577         nf = libcfs_lnd2netstrfns(lnd);
00578         if (nf == NULL) {
00579                 snprintf(buf, buf_size, "%x@<%u:%u>", addr, lnd, nnum);
00580         } else {
00581                 size_t addr_len;
00582 
00583                 nf->nf_addr2str(addr, buf, buf_size);
00584                 addr_len = strlen(buf);
00585                 if (nnum == 0)
00586                         snprintf(buf + addr_len, buf_size - addr_len, "@%s",
00587                                  nf->nf_name);
00588                 else
00589                         snprintf(buf + addr_len, buf_size - addr_len, "@%s%u",
00590                                  nf->nf_name, nnum);
00591         }
00592 
00593         return buf;
00594 }
00595 
00596 static struct netstrfns *
00597 libcfs_str2net_internal(const char *str, __u32 *net)
00598 {
00599         struct netstrfns *nf = NULL;
00600         int               nob;
00601         unsigned int      netnum;
00602         int               i;
00603 
00604         for (i = 0; i < libcfs_nnetstrfns; i++) {
00605                 nf = &libcfs_netstrfns[i];
00606                 if (!strncmp(str, nf->nf_name, strlen(nf->nf_name)))
00607                         break;
00608         }
00609 
00610         if (i == libcfs_nnetstrfns)
00611                 return NULL;
00612 
00613         nob = strlen(nf->nf_name);
00614 
00615         if (strlen(str) == (unsigned int)nob) {
00616                 netnum = 0;
00617         } else {
00618                 if (nf->nf_type == LOLND) /* net number not allowed */
00619                         return NULL;
00620 
00621                 str += nob;
00622                 i = strlen(str);
00623                 if (sscanf(str, "%u%n", &netnum, &i) < 1 ||
00624                     i != (int)strlen(str))
00625                         return NULL;
00626         }
00627 
00628         *net = LNET_MKNET(nf->nf_type, netnum);
00629         return nf;
00630 }
00631 
00632 __u32
00633 libcfs_str2net(const char *str)
00634 {
00635         __u32  net;
00636 
00637         if (libcfs_str2net_internal(str, &net) != NULL)
00638                 return net;
00639 
00640         return LNET_NIDNET(LNET_NID_ANY);
00641 }
00642 
00643 lnet_nid_t
00644 libcfs_str2nid(const char *str)
00645 {
00646         const char       *sep = strchr(str, '@');
00647         struct netstrfns *nf;
00648         __u32             net;
00649         __u32             addr;
00650 
00651         if (sep != NULL) {
00652                 nf = libcfs_str2net_internal(sep + 1, &net);
00653                 if (nf == NULL)
00654                         return LNET_NID_ANY;
00655         } else {
00656                 sep = str + strlen(str);
00657                 net = LNET_MKNET(SOCKLND, 0);
00658                 nf = libcfs_lnd2netstrfns(SOCKLND);
00659                 assert(nf != NULL);
00660         }
00661 
00662         if (!nf->nf_str2addr(str, (int)(sep - str), &addr))
00663                 return LNET_NID_ANY;
00664 
00665         return LNET_MKNID(net, addr);
00666 }
00667 
00668 char *
00669 libcfs_id2str(lnet_process_id_t id)
00670 {
00671         char *str = libcfs_next_nidstring();
00672 
00673         if (id.pid == LNET_PID_ANY) {
00674                 snprintf(str, LNET_NIDSTR_SIZE,
00675                          "LNET_PID_ANY-%s", libcfs_nid2str(id.nid));
00676                 return str;
00677         }
00678 
00679         snprintf(str, LNET_NIDSTR_SIZE, "%s%u-%s",
00680                  ((id.pid & LNET_PID_USERFLAG) != 0) ? "U" : "",
00681                  (id.pid & ~LNET_PID_USERFLAG), libcfs_nid2str(id.nid));
00682         return str;
00683 }
00684 
00685 int
00686 libcfs_str2anynid(lnet_nid_t *nidp, const char *str)
00687 {
00688         if (!strcmp(str, "*")) {
00689                 *nidp = LNET_NID_ANY;
00690                 return 1;
00691         }
00692 
00693         *nidp = libcfs_str2nid(str);
00694         return *nidp != LNET_NID_ANY;
00695 }
00696 
00725 struct nidrange {
00730         struct list_head nr_link;
00734         struct list_head nr_addrranges;
00738         int nr_all;
00742         struct netstrfns *nr_netstrfns;
00746         int nr_netnum;
00747 };
00748 
00752 struct addrrange {
00756         struct list_head ar_link;
00760         struct list_head ar_numaddr_ranges;
00761 };
00762 
00772 static int
00773 parse_addrange(const struct cfs_lstr *src, struct nidrange *nidrange)
00774 {
00775         struct addrrange *addrrange;
00776 
00777         if (src->ls_len == 1 && src->ls_str[0] == '*') {
00778                 nidrange->nr_all = 1;
00779                 return 0;
00780         }
00781 
00782         addrrange = calloc(1, sizeof(struct addrrange));
00783         if (addrrange == NULL)
00784                 return -ENOMEM;
00785         list_add_tail(&addrrange->ar_link, &nidrange->nr_addrranges);
00786         INIT_LIST_HEAD(&addrrange->ar_numaddr_ranges);
00787 
00788         return nidrange->nr_netstrfns->nf_parse_addrlist(src->ls_str,
00789                                                 src->ls_len,
00790                                                 &addrrange->ar_numaddr_ranges);
00791 }
00792 
00803 static struct nidrange *
00804 add_nidrange(const struct cfs_lstr *src,
00805              struct list_head *nidlist)
00806 {
00807         struct netstrfns *nf;
00808         struct nidrange *nr;
00809         int endlen;
00810         unsigned netnum;
00811 
00812         if (src->ls_len >= LNET_NIDSTR_SIZE)
00813                 return NULL;
00814 
00815         nf = libcfs_namenum2netstrfns(src->ls_str);
00816         if (nf == NULL)
00817                 return NULL;
00818         endlen = src->ls_len - strlen(nf->nf_name);
00819         if (endlen == 0)
00820                 /* network name only, e.g. "elan" or "tcp" */
00821                 netnum = 0;
00822         else {
00823                 /* e.g. "elan25" or "tcp23", refuse to parse if
00824                  * network name is not appended with decimal or
00825                  * hexadecimal number */
00826                 if (!cfs_str2num_check(src->ls_str + strlen(nf->nf_name),
00827                                        endlen, &netnum, 0, MAX_NUMERIC_VALUE))
00828                         return NULL;
00829         }
00830 
00831         list_for_each_entry(nr, nidlist, nr_link) {
00832                 if (nr->nr_netstrfns != nf)
00833                         continue;
00834                 if (nr->nr_netnum != netnum)
00835                         continue;
00836                 return nr;
00837         }
00838 
00839         nr = calloc(1, sizeof(struct nidrange));
00840         if (nr == NULL)
00841                 return NULL;
00842         list_add_tail(&nr->nr_link, nidlist);
00843         INIT_LIST_HEAD(&nr->nr_addrranges);
00844         nr->nr_netstrfns = nf;
00845         nr->nr_all = 0;
00846         nr->nr_netnum = netnum;
00847 
00848         return nr;
00849 }
00850 
00857 static int
00858 parse_nidrange(struct cfs_lstr *src, struct list_head *nidlist)
00859 {
00860         struct cfs_lstr addrrange;
00861         struct cfs_lstr net;
00862         struct cfs_lstr tmp;
00863         struct nidrange *nr;
00864 
00865         tmp = *src;
00866         if (cfs_gettok(src, '@', &addrrange) == 0)
00867                 goto failed;
00868 
00869         if (cfs_gettok(src, '@', &net) == 0 || src->ls_str != NULL)
00870                 goto failed;
00871 
00872         nr = add_nidrange(&net, nidlist);
00873         if (nr == NULL)
00874                 goto failed;
00875 
00876         if (parse_addrange(&addrrange, nr) != 0)
00877                 goto failed;
00878 
00879         return 1;
00880  failed:
00881         fprintf(stderr, "can't parse nidrange: \"%.*s\"\n",
00882                 tmp.ls_len, tmp.ls_str);
00883         return 0;
00884 }
00885 
00894 static void
00895 free_addrranges(struct list_head *list)
00896 {
00897         while (!list_empty(list)) {
00898                 struct addrrange *ar;
00899 
00900                 ar = list_entry(list->next, struct addrrange, ar_link);
00901 
00902                 cfs_expr_list_free_list(&ar->ar_numaddr_ranges);
00903                 list_del(&ar->ar_link);
00904                 free(ar);
00905         }
00906 }
00907 
00916 void
00917 cfs_free_nidlist(struct list_head *list)
00918 {
00919         struct list_head *pos, *next;
00920         struct nidrange *nr;
00921 
00922         list_for_each_safe(pos, next, list) {
00923                 nr = list_entry(pos, struct nidrange, nr_link);
00924                 free_addrranges(&nr->nr_addrranges);
00925                 list_del(pos);
00926                 free(nr);
00927         }
00928 }
00929 
00943 int
00944 cfs_parse_nidlist(char *str, int len, struct list_head *nidlist)
00945 {
00946         struct cfs_lstr src;
00947         struct cfs_lstr res;
00948         int rc;
00949 
00950         src.ls_str = str;
00951         src.ls_len = len;
00952         INIT_LIST_HEAD(nidlist);
00953         while (src.ls_str) {
00954                 rc = cfs_gettok(&src, ' ', &res);
00955                 if (rc == 0) {
00956                         cfs_free_nidlist(nidlist);
00957                         return 0;
00958                 }
00959                 rc = parse_nidrange(&res, nidlist);
00960                 if (rc == 0) {
00961                         cfs_free_nidlist(nidlist);
00962                         return 0;
00963                 }
00964         }
00965         return 1;
00966 }
00967 
00976 int cfs_match_nid(lnet_nid_t nid, struct list_head *nidlist)
00977 {
00978         struct nidrange *nr;
00979         struct addrrange *ar;
00980 
00981         list_for_each_entry(nr, nidlist, nr_link) {
00982                 if (nr->nr_netstrfns->nf_type != LNET_NETTYP(LNET_NIDNET(nid)))
00983                         continue;
00984                 if (nr->nr_netnum != LNET_NETNUM(LNET_NIDNET(nid)))
00985                         continue;
00986                 if (nr->nr_all)
00987                         return 1;
00988                 list_for_each_entry(ar, &nr->nr_addrranges, ar_link)
00989                         if (nr->nr_netstrfns->nf_match_addr(LNET_NIDADDR(nid),
00990                                                         &ar->ar_numaddr_ranges))
00991                                 return 1;
00992         }
00993         return 0;
00994 }
00995 
01001 static int
01002 cfs_print_network(char *buffer, int count, struct nidrange *nr)
01003 {
01004         struct netstrfns *nf = nr->nr_netstrfns;
01005 
01006         if (nr->nr_netnum == 0)
01007                 return snprintf(buffer, count, "@%s", nf->nf_name);
01008         else
01009                 return snprintf(buffer, count, "@%s%u",
01010                                     nf->nf_name, nr->nr_netnum);
01011 }
01012 
01013 
01020 static int
01021 cfs_print_addrranges(char *buffer, int count, struct list_head *addrranges,
01022                      struct nidrange *nr)
01023 {
01024         int i = 0;
01025         struct addrrange *ar;
01026         struct netstrfns *nf = nr->nr_netstrfns;
01027 
01028         list_for_each_entry(ar, addrranges, ar_link) {
01029                 if (i != 0)
01030                         i += snprintf(buffer + i, count - i, " ");
01031                 i += nf->nf_print_addrlist(buffer + i, count - i,
01032                                            &ar->ar_numaddr_ranges);
01033                 i += cfs_print_network(buffer + i, count - i, nr);
01034         }
01035         return i;
01036 }
01037 
01045 int cfs_print_nidlist(char *buffer, int count, struct list_head *nidlist)
01046 {
01047         int i = 0;
01048         struct nidrange *nr;
01049 
01050         if (count <= 0)
01051                 return 0;
01052 
01053         list_for_each_entry(nr, nidlist, nr_link) {
01054                 if (i != 0)
01055                         i += snprintf(buffer + i, count - i, " ");
01056 
01057                 if (nr->nr_all != 0) {
01058                         assert(list_empty(&nr->nr_addrranges));
01059                         i += snprintf(buffer + i, count - i, "*");
01060                         i += cfs_print_network(buffer + i, count - i, nr);
01061                 } else {
01062                         i += cfs_print_addrranges(buffer + i, count - i,
01063                                                   &nr->nr_addrranges, nr);
01064                 }
01065         }
01066         return i;
01067 }
01068 
01077 static void cfs_ip_ar_min_max(struct addrrange *ar, __u32 *min_nid,
01078                               __u32 *max_nid)
01079 {
01080         struct cfs_expr_list    *el;
01081         struct cfs_range_expr   *re;
01082         __u32                   tmp_ip_addr = 0;
01083         unsigned int            min_ip[4] = {0};
01084         unsigned int            max_ip[4] = {0};
01085         int                     re_count = 0;
01086 
01087         list_for_each_entry(el, &ar->ar_numaddr_ranges, el_link) {
01088                 list_for_each_entry(re, &el->el_exprs, re_link) {
01089                         min_ip[re_count] = re->re_lo;
01090                         max_ip[re_count] = re->re_hi;
01091                         re_count++;
01092                 }
01093         }
01094 
01095         tmp_ip_addr = ((min_ip[0] << 24) | (min_ip[1] << 16) |
01096                        (min_ip[2] << 8) | min_ip[3]);
01097 
01098         if (min_nid != NULL)
01099                 *min_nid = tmp_ip_addr;
01100 
01101         tmp_ip_addr = ((max_ip[0] << 24) | (max_ip[1] << 16) |
01102                        (max_ip[2] << 8) | max_ip[3]);
01103 
01104         if (max_nid != NULL)
01105                 *max_nid = tmp_ip_addr;
01106 }
01107 
01116 static void cfs_num_ar_min_max(struct addrrange *ar, __u32 *min_nid,
01117                                __u32 *max_nid)
01118 {
01119         struct cfs_expr_list    *el;
01120         struct cfs_range_expr   *re;
01121         unsigned int            min_addr = 0;
01122         unsigned int            max_addr = 0;
01123 
01124         list_for_each_entry(el, &ar->ar_numaddr_ranges, el_link) {
01125                 list_for_each_entry(re, &el->el_exprs, re_link) {
01126                         if (re->re_lo < min_addr || min_addr == 0)
01127                                 min_addr = re->re_lo;
01128                         if (re->re_hi > max_addr)
01129                                 max_addr = re->re_hi;
01130                 }
01131         }
01132 
01133         if (min_nid != NULL)
01134                 *min_nid = min_addr;
01135         if (max_nid != NULL)
01136                 *max_nid = max_addr;
01137 }
01138 
01148 bool cfs_nidrange_is_contiguous(struct list_head *nidlist)
01149 {
01150         struct nidrange         *nr;
01151         struct netstrfns        *nf = NULL;
01152         char                    *lndname = NULL;
01153         int                     netnum = -1;
01154 
01155         list_for_each_entry(nr, nidlist, nr_link) {
01156                 nf = nr->nr_netstrfns;
01157                 if (lndname == NULL)
01158                         lndname = nf->nf_name;
01159                 if (netnum == -1)
01160                         netnum = nr->nr_netnum;
01161 
01162                 if (strcmp(lndname, nf->nf_name) != 0 ||
01163                     netnum != nr->nr_netnum)
01164                         return false;
01165         }
01166 
01167         if (nf == NULL)
01168                 return false;
01169 
01170         if (!nf->nf_is_contiguous(nidlist))
01171                 return false;
01172 
01173         return true;
01174 }
01175 
01185 static bool cfs_num_is_contiguous(struct list_head *nidlist)
01186 {
01187         struct nidrange         *nr;
01188         struct addrrange        *ar;
01189         struct cfs_expr_list    *el;
01190         struct cfs_range_expr   *re;
01191         int                     last_hi = 0;
01192         __u32                   last_end_nid = 0;
01193         __u32                   current_start_nid = 0;
01194         __u32                   current_end_nid = 0;
01195 
01196         list_for_each_entry(nr, nidlist, nr_link) {
01197                 list_for_each_entry(ar, &nr->nr_addrranges, ar_link) {
01198                         cfs_num_ar_min_max(ar, &current_start_nid,
01199                                            &current_end_nid);
01200                         if (last_end_nid != 0 &&
01201                             (current_start_nid - last_end_nid != 1))
01202                                         return false;
01203                         last_end_nid = current_end_nid;
01204                         list_for_each_entry(el, &ar->ar_numaddr_ranges,
01205                                             el_link) {
01206                                 list_for_each_entry(re, &el->el_exprs,
01207                                                     re_link) {
01208                                         if (re->re_stride > 1)
01209                                                 return false;
01210                                         else if (last_hi != 0 &&
01211                                                  re->re_hi - last_hi != 1)
01212                                                 return false;
01213                                         last_hi = re->re_hi;
01214                                 }
01215                         }
01216                 }
01217         }
01218 
01219         return true;
01220 }
01221 
01231 static bool cfs_ip_is_contiguous(struct list_head *nidlist)
01232 {
01233         struct nidrange         *nr;
01234         struct addrrange        *ar;
01235         struct cfs_expr_list    *el;
01236         struct cfs_range_expr   *re;
01237         int                     expr_count;
01238         int                     last_hi = 255;
01239         int                     last_diff = 0;
01240         __u32                   last_end_nid = 0;
01241         __u32                   current_start_nid = 0;
01242         __u32                   current_end_nid = 0;
01243 
01244         list_for_each_entry(nr, nidlist, nr_link) {
01245                 list_for_each_entry(ar, &nr->nr_addrranges, ar_link) {
01246                         last_hi = 255;
01247                         last_diff = 0;
01248                         cfs_ip_ar_min_max(ar, &current_start_nid,
01249                                           &current_end_nid);
01250                         if (last_end_nid != 0 &&
01251                             (current_start_nid - last_end_nid != 1))
01252                                         return false;
01253                         last_end_nid = current_end_nid;
01254                         list_for_each_entry(el,
01255                                             &ar->ar_numaddr_ranges,
01256                                             el_link) {
01257                                 expr_count = 0;
01258                                 list_for_each_entry(re, &el->el_exprs,
01259                                                     re_link) {
01260                                         expr_count++;
01261                                         if (re->re_stride > 1 ||
01262                                             (last_diff > 0 && last_hi != 255) ||
01263                                             (last_diff > 0 && last_hi == 255 &&
01264                                              re->re_lo > 0))
01265                                                 return false;
01266                                         last_hi = re->re_hi;
01267                                         last_diff = re->re_hi - re->re_lo;
01268                                 }
01269                         }
01270                 }
01271         }
01272 
01273         return true;
01274 }
01275 
01284 void cfs_nidrange_find_min_max(struct list_head *nidlist, char *min_nid,
01285                                char *max_nid, size_t nidstr_length)
01286 {
01287         struct nidrange         *nr;
01288         struct netstrfns        *nf = NULL;
01289         int                     netnum = -1;
01290         __u32                   min_addr;
01291         __u32                   max_addr;
01292         char                    *lndname = NULL;
01293         char                    min_addr_str[IPSTRING_LENGTH];
01294         char                    max_addr_str[IPSTRING_LENGTH];
01295 
01296         list_for_each_entry(nr, nidlist, nr_link) {
01297                 nf = nr->nr_netstrfns;
01298                 lndname = nf->nf_name;
01299                 if (netnum == -1)
01300                         netnum = nr->nr_netnum;
01301 
01302                 nf->nf_min_max(nidlist, &min_addr, &max_addr);
01303         }
01304         nf->nf_addr2str(min_addr, min_addr_str, sizeof(min_addr_str));
01305         nf->nf_addr2str(max_addr, max_addr_str, sizeof(max_addr_str));
01306 
01307         snprintf(min_nid, nidstr_length, "%s@%s%d", min_addr_str, lndname,
01308                  netnum);
01309         snprintf(max_nid, nidstr_length, "%s@%s%d", max_addr_str, lndname,
01310                  netnum);
01311 }
01312 
01320 static void cfs_num_min_max(struct list_head *nidlist, __u32 *min_nid,
01321                             __u32 *max_nid)
01322 {
01323         struct nidrange         *nr;
01324         struct addrrange        *ar;
01325         unsigned int            tmp_min_addr = 0;
01326         unsigned int            tmp_max_addr = 0;
01327         unsigned int            min_addr = 0;
01328         unsigned int            max_addr = 0;
01329 
01330         list_for_each_entry(nr, nidlist, nr_link) {
01331                 list_for_each_entry(ar, &nr->nr_addrranges, ar_link) {
01332                         cfs_num_ar_min_max(ar, &tmp_min_addr,
01333                                            &tmp_max_addr);
01334                         if (tmp_min_addr < min_addr || min_addr == 0)
01335                                 min_addr = tmp_min_addr;
01336                         if (tmp_max_addr > max_addr)
01337                                 max_addr = tmp_min_addr;
01338                 }
01339         }
01340         *max_nid = max_addr;
01341         *min_nid = min_addr;
01342 }
01343 
01352 static void cfs_ip_min_max(struct list_head *nidlist, __u32 *min_nid,
01353                            __u32 *max_nid)
01354 {
01355         struct nidrange         *nr;
01356         struct addrrange        *ar;
01357         __u32                   tmp_min_ip_addr = 0;
01358         __u32                   tmp_max_ip_addr = 0;
01359         __u32                   min_ip_addr = 0;
01360         __u32                   max_ip_addr = 0;
01361 
01362         list_for_each_entry(nr, nidlist, nr_link) {
01363                 list_for_each_entry(ar, &nr->nr_addrranges, ar_link) {
01364                         cfs_ip_ar_min_max(ar, &tmp_min_ip_addr,
01365                                           &tmp_max_ip_addr);
01366                         if (tmp_min_ip_addr < min_ip_addr || min_ip_addr == 0)
01367                                 min_ip_addr = tmp_min_ip_addr;
01368                         if (tmp_max_ip_addr > max_ip_addr)
01369                                 max_ip_addr = tmp_max_ip_addr;
01370                 }
01371         }
01372 
01373         if (min_nid != NULL)
01374                 *min_nid = min_ip_addr;
01375         if (max_nid != NULL)
01376                 *max_nid = max_ip_addr;
01377 }
